summary.intent: Make error, suggestion, and remediate count badges in the report header more visible by adding colored backgrounds instead of the uniform gray styling.
summary.outcome: Successfully added colored count badges: red for errors, amber for suggestions, and green for remediate. Modified TabItem interface to support countClassName prop, added three CSS variants, and applied them in App.tsx tab configuration.

repo: Report header uses a Tabs component with configurable tab items that include counts
Tailwind CSS is built into frontend/dist/output.css and needs to be rebuilt after style changes
Project has comprehensive test suite (1226 tests) that runs before commits

code.finding: TabItem interface can be extended with optional styling props like countClassName
Custom tab styling uses utility classes with active state variants following pattern .tab-count-{variant} and .tab-button.active .tab-count-{variant}
Tab configuration is centralized in App.tsx where visual properties like countClassName can be assigned per tab

workflow: Hard browser refresh may be needed to see CSS changes even when compiled correctly
Pre-commit hooks run tests, lint, and typecheck automatically
Selective staging of changed files ensures unrelated modifications don't get committed together

friction: Initial confusion about whether CSS changes were applied - required browser hard refresh to see results
Multiple unrelated files were modified in the working tree and had to be explicitly excluded from the commit
